conversation.content: Do you remember what happened on our 47th anniversary? I've been trying to piece together the timeline.

Oh, well, the 47th—that was, you know, when we accidentally turned the entire banquet hall into, er, a flock of flamingos! Still had to pay for 300 dinners even though nobody could eat them, remember?
That was the 47th? I thought the flamingo incident was year 52!
No no, year 52 was when I miscalculated the levitation spell and we spent our anniversary dinner floating on the ceiling for three hours! The waiter had to use a ladder to bring us champagne.
Ugh, I mean, now I'm [groan] completely confused about, um, which disaster happened when.
Actually, I keep [delighted] a detailed log—year 23 was, you know, the dragon egg omelet incident, year 31 was when we, hmm, time-traveled backwards through our own wedding!
Wait, so, what about year, uh, let me think—year 38, that was, basically, something with ice sculptures?
Year 38, yes! I animated all twelve ice sculptures at the winter gala and they started waltzing with the guests—took me four hours to reverse that spell!
The dean's wife [laugh hard] danced with an ice swan for twenty minutes before realizing!
She actually requested I bring it back for year 39's party, said it was the best dance partner she'd had in decades!
Okay but, er, year 44—that one's, like, completely blank in my memory, honestly.
Year 44 was, well, relatively quiet—I only [overly polite] accidentally set fire to three tablecloths, which, um, by our standards, basically counts as a successful evening!
Three tablecloths? That's, you know, [gasp softly] what you call quiet? I guess, er, our standards have really shifted.
Well, hmm, compared to year 19 when I [curious] summoned 2,000 butterflies instead of 20, or, actually, year 67 when the cake grew legs and ran away!
Year 67—so, that's in the future? You're, I mean, mixing up timelines again, um, aren't you?
Oh right, er, sometimes I [friendly] forget which memories are from this timeline—time magic makes anniversaries, you know, rather complicated to track chronologically!
How many anniversaries have we actually had versus how many you remember from various timelines?
In this particular reality, we've had 58 anniversaries, but I remember at least 200 from various temporal loops and parallel dimensions!
Two hundred? That's, well, actually kind of romantic in a, honestly, bizarre wizard way.
Each one special in its own catastrophic way—though I must say, the constants are always you, me, and something inevitably catching fire!
